current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007
		  to improve the coordination of refinery outages, and for other
		  purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Energy and Natural
			 Resources

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Gas Price and Refinery Capacity
			 Relief Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) is
			 amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 804
			 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:804

text.#text:
In
				this section:

term.#tail:
means the Administrator of the Energy
				Information Administration.

text.#text:
The
				term

term.#tail:
means a removal, scheduled before the date on which the removal occurs, of a
				refinery, or any unit of a refinery, from service for maintenance, repair, or
				modification.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means any gasoline, diesel fuel, fuel oil, lubricating oil, liquid petroleum
				gas, or other petroleum distillate that is produced through the refining or
				processing of crude oil or an oil derived from tar sands, shale, or
				coal.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means a facility used in the production of a refined
				petroleum product through distillation, cracking, or any other process.

text.#text:
The
				term

term.#tail:
means
				the removal of a refinery, or any unit of a refinery, from service that is not
				scheduled in advance.

text.#text: The

The owner or operator of a refinery shall submit to
				the

the schedule of
				the refinery for any planned refinery outage, including—

the dates for the
				planned refinery outage at least 1 year in advance of the date of the expected
				outage or the date the outage is scheduled; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:804/ss:b/p:1/sp:A

text.#text:
the estimated
				inventories and production of refined petroleum products during the period
				described in

any unplanned
				refinery outages as soon as practicable
The

header.#text:
Review and
				analysis of available information

text.#text:
review
				information on planned refinery outages and unplanned refinery outages—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:804/ss:b

text.#text:
reported by
				refineries under

that is available
				from commercial reporting services;

analyze that
				information to determine whether the scheduling of a planned refinery outage or
				an unplanned refinery outage may nationally or regionally substantially affect
				the price or supply of any refined petroleum product by—

decreasing the
				production of the refined petroleum product; and

causing or
				contributing to a retail or wholesale supply shortage or disruption; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of any refinery outage that the

determines may
				nationally or regionally substantially affect the price or supply of a refined
				petroleum product.

text.#text: alert the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that a refinery
				outage may affect the price or supply of a refined petroleum product, the

shall make available to refinery operators information on planned
				refinery outages or unplanned refinery outages to prevent significant market
				disruptions.

text.#text: On a determination by the

Nothing
				in this section—

alters any
				existing legal obligation or responsibility of a refinery operator;

creates any legal
				right of action; or
authorizes the

to prohibit a
				refinery operator from conducting a planned refinery outage; or

to require a
				refinery operator to continue to operate a refinery.

header.#text:
Study on
				national strategic refined petroleum products reserve

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on
				the costs and benefits of creating a national strategic refined petroleum
				products reserve for refined petroleum products.

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of
				this subsection, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:804/ss:f/p:1

text.#text:
The
				report required under

the feasibility
				of increasing storage capacity for refined petroleum products on a regional
				basis; and

the impact
				additional storage capacity would have on the retail price of refined petroleum
				products for consumers in the event of a supply shortage or market disruption
				from a natural disaster or refinery
				outage.
